## Exercise | Per Capita Transformation
<p class="subheader">How does dividing by population change the ranking?</p>

<br><br>

Lets transform total GDP to GDP per capita.

- **Data:** `GDP_Population_2019.csv`

---

## S-T-E for Per Capita Transformations
<p class="subheader">What we just did</p>

| Step | Action |
|------|--------|
| SELECT | All countries with GDP and population data |
| TRANSFORM | Divide GDP by population |
| ENCODE | Country → y-position; GDP per capita → bar length |

. . .

*> TRANSFORM divides by population to normalize across different-sized countries*

---

## Summary
<p class="subheader">Per capita transformations reveal different patterns</p>

<br><br>

::: {.incremental}
- **Per capita** means "per person" — divide by population
- Total values favor large countries
- Per capita values show intensity or living standards
- The same data tells different stories depending on the transformation
:::
